meanings.definition: The practice of officially examining books, movies, etc., and suppressing unacceptable parts.
meanings.sent1: Censorships can prevent certain information from reaching the public.
meanings.sent2: The government imposed strict censorships on the film industry.
meanings.sent3: The librarian joked that the censorships were so strict, even the punctuation marks were censored.
meanings.sent4: In the world of censorships, some stories remain forever silenced.
meanings.sent5: The shadow of censorships loomed over the creative process, stifling expression.

meanings.definition: The suppression or prohibition of any parts of books, films, news, etc. that are considered obscene, politically unacceptable, or a threat to security.
meanings.sent1: Censorships in the media can sometimes lead to biased information.
meanings.sent2: The censorships in place aimed to protect the public from harmful content.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the absurdity of censorships by pretending to censor his own jokes.
meanings.sent4: Under the veil of censorships, the truth can be distorted beyond recognition.
meanings.sent5: The impact of censorships on freedom of speech cannot be underestimated.
